column2: format=A5 glossy paperback, black and white

column1: '''''Aiglos Special Issue II. A selection of Tolkien studies in Poland 2006-2011''''' is the second English-language issue of '''''[[Aiglos (journal)
column2: Aiglos]]''''', prepared for the [[The Return of the Ring
column3: Return of the Ring]] conference celebrating the seventy fifth anniversary of the publication of ''[[The Hobbit]]'' by J.R.R.Tolkien.<ref>"Dear Readers" at ''Aiglos''' official page http://aiglos.tolkien.com.pl/english/index.php (accessed 1 September 2016)</ref>

column1: ** "Tolkien and the Vikings. J.R.R. Tolkien's connection with the Victorian literature concerning the North"
** "Language and myth. Tolkien’s and Barfield’s concepts of 'meaning'"
** "Who are you, and what are you doing in this land? A different way of looking at known things – an epic reading of ''The Lord of the Rings''"
** "The Rivendell Hymnal and Tenebrae – Tolkien, Elves and the Roman Liturgy"
** "Three Men in a Boat (To Say Nothing of Huan)"
** "''Mythopoeia'' and ''Quenta Silmarillion'' by J.R.R. Tolkien – God, faith, freedom, and the Second Coming"
** "Nerdanel. A few words about an episode which did not have to be a mere episode"
** "Word, power and will – magic in the writings of J.R.R. Tolkien"
** "The Sense of Unity and the Category of Unity. Tolkien's ''The Lord of the Rings'' in the Context of Medieval Epic"
** "''The Volsunga Saga'' as an Inspiration for J.R.R. Tolkien"
** "Master of Doom and Ring-bearer: Fate and Free Will in Middle-earth of the First and the Third Ages"
** "Believe neither editors nor translators, or how I almost rubbed shoulders with a celebrity"
** A selection of poems by Anna Adamczyk-Śliwińska 'Nifrodel' in Bożena Mitko 'Nellelórë'’s translation
** Interview with [[Christina Scull]] and [[Wayne G. Hammond]] - from [[Aiglos 6]] (Spring/Summer [[2006]]) (with recent footnotes)
** Review: ''A Fortress Made of Ice: The Silmarillion. Thirty Years On'', ed: Allan Turner
** Review: "Destroying the tower built in Beleriand. ''Arda Reconstructed'', i.e. a handful of comments on the book by Douglas Kane, on Tolkienologists and on Christopher Tolkien's edition"
** Review: "A Truly Monumental Work. A Handful of Remarks on ''J. R. R. Tolkien Companion and Guide'' by Christina Scull and Wayne G. Hammond"
** Review: ''A Fairy Tale and Orality in Tolkien's Texts'' (Adrian Jakuboze, Maria E. Pobieżyńska, Michał Żaczek, ''Baśń - oralność - zagadka'')
** Review: "''The Lord of the Rings'', the book and the film as seen by the students of the Adam Mickiewicz University"
** Review: "The History of an unusual Friendship? Colin Duriez, ''Tolkien and C.S. Lewis: The Gift of Friendship''"

column2: Karolina Stopa-Olszańska 'Melinir']]<ref>''Aiglos Special Issue II'', August 2012</ref>

column1: Translation into English: Katarzyna Blacharska, Justyna Brzezińska, Arkadiusz Janczyło, Sławomir Kułacz, Alicja Laskowska 'Freawaru', Magdalena Mańko-Kuzaj, Bożena Mitko 'Nellelórë', Joanna Piech and Agnieszka Sylwanowicz 'Evermind HS Took'.<ref>''Aiglos Special Issue II'' at ''Aiglos''' official page http://aiglos.tolkien.com.pl/english/special2.php (accessed 1 September 2016)</ref><ref>''Zawartość numeru SI 2'' at ''Aiglos''' official page http://aiglos.tolkien.com.pl/numer-si2.php (accessed 1 September 2016)</ref>
